title: Pickled Shrimp with Creamy Spinach Dip
summary: Pickled Shrimp with Creamy Spinach Dip might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 402 calories, 26g of protein, and 19g of fat. For $4.02 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. It is perfect for The Super Bowl. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and pescatarian diet. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have jalapeños, heavy cream, lemon juice, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 64%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Creamy Avocado Dip With Scallions, Baked Spinach Dip Loaf, and Avocado Spinach and Artichoke Dip.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Chloe Pinot Grigio with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chloe Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Flavors of juicy white peach, oft melon and crisp apple with a subtle undertone of Meyer Lemon

instructions: In a large saucepan, combine the water, vinegar, sugar, garlic, jalapeos, bay leaves, crushed red pepper, salt, peppercorns and allspice berries and bring to a boil to dissolve the sugar. Add the shrimp and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Transfer the shrimp and liquid to a large bowl and let cool to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate for 8 to 10 hours.                                              In a large saucepan, boil the cream over high heat until reduced by half, about 3 minutes. Add the spinach and cook, stirring, until wilted, about 1 minute. Transfer the spinach mixture to a bowl and let cool. Stir in the crme frache and lemon juice and season with salt.                                              Using a slotted spoon, lift the shrimp and jalapeos from the marinade and arrange on a platter. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve the spinach dip in a bowl alongside.

steps.step: In a large saucepan, combine the water, vinegar, sugar, garlic, jalapeos, bay leaves, crushed red pepper, salt, peppercorns and allspice berries and bring to a boil to dissolve the sugar.
Add the shrimp and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Transfer the shrimp and liquid to a large bowl and let cool to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate for 8 to 10 hours.
In a large saucepan, boil the cream over high heat until reduced by half, about 3 minutes.
Add the spinach and cook, stirring, until wilted, about 1 minute.
Transfer the spinach mixture to a bowl and let cool. Stir in the crme frache and lemon juice and season with salt.
Using a slotted spoon, lift the shrimp and jalapeos from the marinade and arrange on a platter.
Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve the spinach dip in a bowl alongside.
